In other places where we use config, we usually create the following:

static factory method builder() - already in this class
method Builder.config(Config) - already in builder
static factory method create(Config)

this method is not that useful

if you want to create MediaSupport from config only (if that is even feasible), add the create(Config) method
if you want to update the builder from config and then do more with the builder, just use builder().config(Config)

This shortcut does not seem useful.

config can never be null
Our APIs never accept null as a valid parameter - this should throw a NPE

Please use
config("server-errors-include-stack-traces").asBoolean().ifPresent(this::serverErrorsIncludeStackTraces)
The problem with your approach:

if the serverErrorsIncludeStackTraces is configured by "hand" and then you update it with config, you override the value even though config does not include that configuration key
the configuration keys should be dash separated, not camel case
there are shortcuts for primitives and string on config (e.g. use asBoolean() rather than as(Boolean.class) or as(Boolean.TYPE))
I do not see a setter for the serverErrorsIncludeStackTraces field in builder, add public Builder serverErrorsIncludeStackTraces(boolean) method - everything configurable through config should be configurable through a builder.
